text: Coats is a city in Pratt County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 68 people lived there. ==History== Coats was created in about 1887. William A. Coats created it. It was named after himself. Coats was incorporated as a city in 1909. The first post office in Coats was created in June 1887. ==Geography== Coats is at (37.51078, -98.825338). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ===Weather=== Coats has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification system says that Coats has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Coats, Kansas ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 68 people, 32 households, and 21 families living in the city. Of the households, 81.3% owned their home and 18.8% rented their home. The median age was 45.3 years. Of the people, 91.2% were White, 1.5% were Native American, 4.4% were from some other race, and 2.9% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 13.2% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 83 people, 31 households, and 21 families residing in the city. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Coats - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 438, local school district ;Maps * Coats City Map , KDOT Category:Cities in Pratt County, Kansas Category:1887 establishments in Kansas
title: Coats, Kansas
